questions.text: A 3-month-old with cyanosis, feeding difficulties, shortness of breath, and failure to thrive. Ejection systolic murmur is heard on auscultation. Which of the following is not a component of the diagnosis?

options.label: C
options.text: Right ventricular hypertrophy and overriding of the aorta.

questions.explanation:
Solution:

None of the above.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Right ventricular tract obstruction : it is the component of tetralogy of Fallot. Option: B. Ventricular septum defect: it is the component of tetralogy of Fallot. Option: C. Right ventricular hypertrophy and overriding of the aorta: it is the component of tetralogy of the Fallot.

questions.text: A 4-month-old presented with cyanosis, feeding difficulties, shortness of breath, and failure to thrive. Ejection systolic murmur is heard on auscultation. Which of the following can be a treatment option for this pt?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

All of the above The diagnosis is TETRALOGY OF FALLOT: Tetralogy of Fallot is the most common form of cyanotic heart disease. It involves singular deviation of the anterior coronal septum, resulting in Right ventricular tract obstruction, Ventricular septum defect Right ventricular hypertrophy Overriding of the aorta. Treatment: Blalock Taussig, Pott’s, Waterston shunts.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Blalock Taussig shunt: it is the treatment option for tetralogy of Fallot . Option: B. Pott’s shunt: it is the treatment option for tetralogy of Fallot. Option: C. Waterston shunts: it is the treatment option for tetralogy of Fallot.

questions.text: A shunt diagram of a 2-month-old with congenital cyanotic heart disease is shown below. What is your diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Tetralogy of fallot The shunt diagram is of TOF as It involves singular deviation of the anterior coronal septum, resulting in right ventricular tract obstruction, ventricular septum defect, right ventricular hypertrophy, and overriding of the aorta which is shown here.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: B. Ventricular septal defect: in the above shunt diagram there is not only a ventricular septal defect but also the presence of right ventricular tract obstruction, right ventricular hypertrophy, and overriding of the aorta. Option: C. Pulmonary stenosis: in the above shunt diagram there is not only pulmonary stenosis but also the presence of a ventricular septal defect, right ventricular hypertrophy, and overriding of the aorta.

questions.text: A 2 months old with congenital heart disease was advised chest Xray and was shown below. What is your diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Ebstein's anomaly In this x-ray, we can see a box-shaped heart which is characteristic of Ebstein's anomaly . It is a congenital heart defect in which the septal and posterior leaflets of the tricuspid valve are displaced towards the apex of the right ventricle of the heart

Highyeild:

Cyanotic heart ds. X-ray finding 1. TOF Boot shape heart 2. TGA Egg on string 3. Supracardiac TAPVC snowman/ figure of eight/ cottage leaf 4. Coarctation of aorta Figure of three.Notching of inf. Margin of ribs 5. Ebstein anomaly Box shape heart

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A.- Tetralogy of Fallot- boot shape heart.
